Each of us has a role to play in the work of repair and healing in the coming days, months and years. Justice does not come easily, but together, I know we will defeat the evil at the root of the hate and violence we see around us and create a world worthy of our best ideals.

It cannot be lost on any of us that the shooter targeted the Jewish community in part for its strong support of refugees and immigrants. Tonight‚Äôs vigil reminds us of the the urgent need for us to speak out loudly and clearly against those who seek to divide us.

These men and women were unacceptably targeted simply for being Jewish. Through song, prayer and the rituals of the Jewish tradition today, we rejected anti-Semitism, honored those who lost their lives and recommitted ourselves to a world without hate.

At Temple de Hirsch Sinai, I stood proudly with thousands who gathered to show our deepest support for the Jewish community as we remembered the 11 men and women murdered in Pittsburgh at the Tree of Life synagogue. https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/thousands-gather-in-seattle-for-vigil-mourning-pittsburgh-synagogue-massacre/

Visiting door to door to explain how to register with FEMA. Registration is the first step in getting help to repair your home or replace what you lost in the typhoon. Call 1.800.621.3362 or log in to http://www.disasterassistance.gov. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DqxZnI-XgAAuczB.jpg

The Congressional office staff is trained and available to help you register with @FEMA. Call us at 323-2647 or come by our office in the JCT II Building, Joeten Center, Susupe, Saipan. We are open from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. #YutuRelief http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dqx877TX0AEgOIr.jpg

- Power has been restored to Navy Hill and Garapan. Power plant in Lower Base not severely damaged. 
- United flights are now allowing inbound passengers. Around 1500 tourists have already left the Marianas. 
- Minor repairs needed to Tinian school. Tinian Clinic is operating

General Updates:
- U.S. Postal Services have resumed. 
- Army Corps is inspecting generators for CUC water wells.
- Reverse osmosis systems and generators have arrived.
- Seaports and airports are open to allow relief supplies and personnel.
- Applicants interested in Small Business Administration disaster loans must still first register through FEMA

- FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams (DSATs) are going to shelters to help with registration
- FEMA Disability Integration Assistance teams and DSATs are coordinating assistance for people with disabilities.

- Any info faxed to FEMA should include registration # on each page
- After registration, applicants will get a letter from FEMA explaining what to expect next. An inspector will call, usually w/in 7-10 days of registration. Inspectors are on island now & inspections have started

- Applicants will be asked to show proof of property ownership or occupancy (if tenants).
- Non-U.S. parents of U.S. citizen children may register for FEMA as co-applicants. If a minor child is listed as an applicant, must provide birth certificate and Social Security copies.

I am already working with Leader .@NancyPelosi and the Appropriations Committee to put together a package of assistance for the Marianas. I am very grateful for her assurance of help from Congress and the American people.

#TyphoonYutu
